extracted_data.playbook: 1. Use http_request to fetch https://data.sec.gov/submissions/CIK{CIK_PADDED}.json with headers User-Agent: 'ResearchBot contact@example.com' - this is the EDGAR REST API that allows programmatic access without browser blocking. 2. Parse the JSON response: data['name'] gives company full name, data['cik'] gives CIK. 3. Search data['filings']['recent']['accessionNumber'] list for the target accession number (format: XXXXXXXXXX-YY-NNNNNN). 4. Use the index found to look up data['filings']['recent']['filingDate'][idx] for the filing date and data['filings']['recent']['form'][idx] to confirm form type. 5. Construct the filing URL as: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/{CIK_NO_LEADING_ZEROS}/{ACCESSION_NO_DASHES}/{ACCESSION_WITH_DASHES}-index.htm. 6. For screenshots: SEC.gov blocks browser automation with 403 errors. Navigate to the page via browser - if blocked, take screenshot of the block page and note data was extracted via API. The data.sec.gov API (not www.sec.gov) works reliably for data extraction. Key gotcha: the CIK in the JSON URL must be zero-padded to 10 digits (CIK0000320193.json), but in the filing URL path use the non-padded numeric form (320193).
